bill_title: to revise certain requirements and rule making authority relating to implementation of a hunter safety course.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain requirements and rule making authority relating to implementation of a hunter safety course. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-7-1 be amended to read as follows: 41-7-1. Notwithstanding § 41-6-13, no hunting license may be issued to any person under the age of sixteen years unless he the applicant presents to the person authorized to issue such license a certificate of competency successful completion as provided in this chapter rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission, pursuant to chapter 1-26 , an appropriate certificate of successful completion of a hunter safety or hunter education course from another state or province of Canada, or a hunting license issued to him the applicant in the current or previous year. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 41-7-2 be amended to read as follows: 41-7-2. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall may provide by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 for a course of instruction and training in the safe handling of firearms and for that purpose shall cooperate with the public school system for such training other hunting implements, provide for compensation to instructors, issuance of a certificate of successful completion, and recognition of successful completion of a hunter safety or hunter education course in other jurisdictions . Section 3. That § 41-7-3 be repealed. 41-7-3. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall make arrangements with the local city superintendent of schools in the third class municipalities wherein courses in the safe handling of firearms are to be offered and the schools so selected shall make available their facilities for such instruction. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall train instructors to teach such classes and shall pay the instructors for their services. The amount expended for such instruction shall not exceed five thousand dollars during any fiscal year. Section 4. That § 41-7-4 be repealed. 41-7-4. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall establish three application dates each year before which applicants must file an application to take the course in the safe handling of firearms. Application forms may be obtained from any superintendent of schools in the state, and the application shall be filed with the superintendent of the school district wherein such applicant attends school. Section 5. That § 41-7-5 be repealed. 41-7-5. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall review the applications under § 41-7-4 and determine the places where schools of instruction will be held and assign the applicant to the school where he is to attend. Section 6. That § 41-7-6 be repealed. 41-7-6. No student taking the course in the safe handling of firearms shall be excused from school to participate in this course during regular school hours. Section 7. That § 41-7-7 be repealed. 41-7-7. Certificates of competency signed by the instructor or by the superintendent of schools wherein the course was offered shall be issued to each person who successfully completes a course of instruction in the safe handling of firearms. Section 8. The effective date of this Act is January 1, 1998.
